as user or root?
As user:  'crontab'.  As root:  edit /etc/crontab, or better, /etc/cron.d/<file>
i'm root
Root also has its own user corontab (maintained with the 'crontab' command and installed in /var/spool/cron/ (I think), but Don't Use That in general.
cornd.pid is a file that contains the PID (process ID) of the currently running cron daemon.  Sometimes the file hangs around after cron has died.  What's the error message?
What are you trying to run?  What do you want to have happen and when?
My suggestion would be to look at /etc/crontab, /etc/cron.d/, and/or /etc/cron.{hourly,daily,weekly,monthly}

... as opposed to by root?
